name: Life Orb
effect: Increases the power of moves, but loses HP each turn.

name: Leftovers
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder's HP is gradually restored during battle.

name: Black Sludge
effect: A held item that gradually restores the HP of Poison-type Pokémon. It inflicts damage on all other types.

name: Focus Sash
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If it has full HP, the holder will endure one potential KO attack, leaving 1 HP.

name: Absorb Bulb
effect: A consumable bulb. If the holder is hit by a Water-type move, its Sp. Atk will rise.

name: Air Balloon
effect: When held by a Pokémon, the Pokémon will float into the air. When the holder is attacked, this item will burst.

name: Assault Vest
effect: Raises Special Defense but prevents the use of status moves.

name: Big Root
effect: Recovers more HP from HP-stealing moves.

name: Binding Band
effect: A band that increases the power of binding moves when held.

name: Black Belt
effect: Increases the power of Fighting-type moves.

name: Black Glasses
effect: Increases the power of Dark-type moves.

name: Blunder Policy
effect: Raises Speed sharply if its attack misses.

name: Bright Powder
effect: Lowers the opponent's accuracy.

name: Bug Memory
effect: Changes Silvally and its move Multi-Attack to Bug type.

name: Burn Drive
effect: Changes Techno Blast to a Fire-type move when held by Genesect.

name: Cell Battery
effect: A consumable battery. If the holder is hit by an Electric-type move, its Attack will rise.

name: Charcoal
effect: Increases the power of Fire-type moves.

name: Chill Drive
effect: Changes Techno Blast to an Ice-type move when held by Genesect.

name: Choice Band
effect: Raises Attack, but only one move can be used.

name: Choice Scarf
effect: Raises Speed, but only one move can be used.

name: Choice Specs
effect: Raises Special Attack, but only one move can be used.

name: Cleanse Tag
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It helps keep wild Pokémon away if the holder is the first one in the party.

name: Damp Rock
effect: A Pokémon held item that extends the duration of the move Rain Dance used by the holder.

name: Dark Memory
effect: Changes Silvally and its move Multi-Attack to Dark type.

name: Deep Sea Scale
effect: Increases Special Defense when held by Clamperl. Evolves Clamperl when traded holding the item.

name: Deep Sea Tooth
effect: Increases Special Attack when held by Clamperl. Evolves Clamperl when traded holding the item.

name: Destiny Knot
effect: A long, thin, bright-red string to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder becomes infatuated, the foe does too.

name: Douse Drive
effect: Changes Techno Blast to a Water-type move when held by Genesect.

name: Draco Plate
effect: Increases power of Dragon-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Dragon.

name: Dragon Fang
effect: Increases the power of Dragon-type moves.

name: Dragon Memory
effect: Changes Silvally and its move Multi-Attack to Dragon type.

name: Dragonium Z
effect: Allows the use of Devastating Drake, the Dragon type Z-Move.

name: Dread Plate
effect: Increases power of Dark-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Dark.

name: Dropped Item
effect: The Xtransceiver found at the Nimbasa City amusement park. It seems it belongs to a boy.

name: Earth Plate
effect: Increases power of Ground-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Ground.

name: Eject Button
effect: If the holder is hit by an attack, it will switch with another Pokémon in your party.

name: Eject Pack
effect: The Pokémon switches out if its stats are lowered.

name: Electric Memory
effect: Changes Silvally and its move Multi-Attack to Electric type.

name: Eviolite
effect: A mysterious evolutionary lump. When held, it raises the Defense and Sp. Def of a Pokémon that can still evolve.

name: Exp. Share
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder gets a share of a battle's Exp. Points without battling.

name: Expert Belt
effect: Increases the power of super-effective moves.

name: Fairy Memory
effect: Changes Silvally and its move Multi-Attack to Fairy type.

name: Fighting Memory
effect: Changes Silvally and its move Multi-Attack to Fighting type.

name: Fire Memory
effect: Changes Silvally and its move Multi-Attack to Fire type.

name: Fist Plate
effect: Increases power of Fighting-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Fighting.

name: Flame Orb
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a bizarre orb that inflicts a burn on the holder in battle.

name: Flame Plate
effect: Increases power of Fire-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Fire.

name: Float Stone
effect: A very light stone. It reduces the weight of a Pokémon when held.

name: Flying Memory
effect: Changes Silvally and its move Multi-Attack to Flying type.

name: Focus Band
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder may endure a potential KO attack, leaving it with just 1 HP.

name: Full Incense
effect: Holder always attacks last. Breeding Snorlax produces Munchlax when held.

name: Ghost Memory
effect: Changes Silvally and its move Multi-Attack to Ghost type.

name: Grass Memory
effect: Changes Silvally and its move Multi-Attack to Grass type.

name: Grip Claw
effect: A Pokémon held item that extends the duration of multiturn attacks like Bind and Wrap.

name: Griseous Orb
effect: Increases the power of Dragon- and Ghost-type moves when held by Giratina, and changes it to Origin Forme.

name: Ground Memory
effect: Changes Silvally and its move Multi-Attack to Ground type.

name: Grubby Hanky
effect: A handkerchief dropped by a regular at Café Warehouse. It smells faintly like a Pokémon.

name: Hard Stone
effect: Increases the power of Rock-type moves.

name: Heat Rock
effect: A Pokémon held item that extends the duration of the move Sunny Day used by the holder.

name: Heavy-Duty Boots
effect: Protects the holder from traps set on the battlefield.

name: Hi-tech Earbuds
effect: Strange earbuds that allow you to freely control the volume of various sounds.

name: Honor Of Kalos
effect: A precious symbol that is awarded only to an individual who has done great things for the Kalos region.

name: Ice Memory
effect: Changes Silvally and its move Multi-Attack to Ice type.

name: Icicle Plate
effect: Increases power of Ice-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Ice.

name: Icy Rock
effect: A Pokémon held item that extends the duration of the move Hail used by the holder.

name: Insect Plate
effect: Increases power of Bug-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Bug.

name: Intriguing Stone
effect: A rather curious stone that might appear to be valuable to some. It's all in the eye of the beholder.

name: Iron Ball
effect: A Pokémon held item that cuts Speed. It makes Flying-type and levitating holders susceptible to Ground moves.

name: Iron Plate
effect: Increases power of Steel-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Steel.

name: King's Rock
effect: May cause opponent to flinch. Evolves Poliwhirl and Slowpoke when traded holding the item.

name: Lagging Tail
effect: Holder always attacks last.

name: Lax Incense
effect: Lowers the opponent's accuracy. Breeding Wobbuffet produces Wynaut when held.

name: Light Ball
effect: An item to be held by PIKACHU. It is a puzzling orb that raises the Attack and Sp. Atk stat.

name: Light Clay
effect: A Pokémon held item that extends the duration of barrier moves like Light Screen and Reflect used by the holder.

name: Looker Ticket
effect: A ticket that was handmade by Looker. It's decorated with a liberal amount of glittery paint.

name: Lucky Egg
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is an egg filled with happiness that earns extra Exp. Points in battle.

name: Lucky Punch
effect: Increases critical-hit ratio when held by Chansey.

name: Luminous Moss
effect: Raises Special Defense if hit by a Water-type move.

name: Lustrous Orb
effect: Increases the power of Dragon- and Water-type moves when held by Palkia.

name: Macho Brace
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a stiff and heavy brace that promotes strong growth but lowers Speed.

name: Magnet
effect: Increases the power of Electric-type moves.

name: Meadow Plate
effect: Increases power of Grass-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Grass.

name: Metal Coat
effect: Increases the power of Steel-type moves. Evolves Onix and Scyther when traded holding the item.

name: Metronome
effect: Increases the power of moves used consecutively.

name: Mind Plate
effect: Increases power of Psychic-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Psychic.

name: Miracle Seed
effect: Increases the power of Grass-type moves.

name: Muscle Band
effect: Increases the power of Physical-category moves.

name: Never-Melt Ice
effect: Increases the power of Ice-type moves.

name: Odd Incense
effect: Increases the power of Psychic-type moves. Breeding Mr. Mime produces Mime Jr. when held.

name: Pass Orb
effect: A mysterious orb containing the power of the Unova region, to be used when generating Pass Power.

name: Pink Nectar
effect: The flower nectar obtained at the flowering shrubs on Royal Avenue. It changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

name: Pixie Plate
effect: Increases power of Fairy-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Fairy.

name: Plasma Card
effect: A card key needed to enter the password inside the Plasma Frigate.

name: Poison Barb
effect: Increases the power of Poison-type moves.

name: Poison Memory
effect: Changes Silvally and its move Multi-Attack to Poison type.

name: Power Anklet
effect: A Pokémon held item that promotes Speed gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

name: Power Band
effect: A Pokémon held item that promotes Sp. Def gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

name: Power Belt
effect: A Pokémon held item that promotes Defense gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

name: Power Bracer
effect: A Pokémon held item that promotes Attack gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

name: Power Herb
effect: A single-use item to be held by a Pokémon. It allows the immediate use of a move that charges on the first turn.

name: Power Lens
effect: A Pokémon held item that promotes Sp. Atk gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

name: Power Plant Pass
effect: This pass serves as an ID card for gaining access to the power plant that lies along Route 13.

name: Power Weight
effect: A Pokémon held item that promotes HP gain on leveling, but reduces the Speed stat.

name: Prison Bottle
effect: Transforms Hoopa Confined to Hoopa Unbound.

name: Prof's Letter
effect: >A letter that Professor Sycamore wrote to your mother. A faint but pleasant perfume seems to cling to the paper.

name: Protective Pads
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. These pads protect the holder from effects caused by making direct contact with the target.

name: Psychic Memory
effect: Changes Silvally and its move Multi-Attack to Psychic type.

name: Pure Incense
effect: Descreases the likelihood of meeting wild Pokémon. Breeding Chimecho produces Chingling when held.

name: Purple Nectar
effect: A flower nectar obtained at Poni Meadow. It changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

name: Quick Claw
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. A light, sharp claw that lets the bearer move first occasionally.

name: Quick Powder
effect: Increases Speed when held by Ditto.

name: Razor Claw
effect: Increases critical-hit ratio. Evolves Sneasel when held at night.

name: Razor Fang
effect: May cause opponent to flinch. Evolves Gligar when held at night.

name: Red Card
effect: A card with a mysterious power. When the holder is struck by a foe, the attacker is removed from battle.

name: Red Nectar
effect: A flower nectar obtained at Ula'ula Meadow. It changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

name: Ring Target
effect: Moves that would otherwise have no effect will land on the Pokémon that holds it.

name: Rock Incense
effect: Increases the power of Rock-type moves. Breeding Sudowoodo produces Bonsly when held.

name: Rock Memory
effect: Changes Silvally and its move Multi-Attack to Rock type.

name: Rocky Helmet
effect: If the holder of this item takes damage, the attacker will also be damaged upon contact.

name: Room Service
effect: Lowers the Pokémon's speed during Trick Room.

name: Rose Incense
effect: Increases the power of Grass-type moves. Breeding Roselia or Roserade produces Budew when held.

name: Safety Goggles
effect: Prevents damage from weather and powder.

name: Scope Lens
effect: Increases critical-hit ratio.

name: Sea Incense
effect: Increases the power of Water-type moves. Breeding Marill or Azumarill produces Azurill when held.

name: Sharp Beak
effect: Increases the power of Flying-type moves.

name: Shed Shell
effect: A tough, discarded carapace to be held by a Pokémon. It enables the holder to switch with a waiting Pokémon in battle.

name: Shell Bell
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder's HP is restored a little every time it inflicts damage.

name: Shock Drive
effect: Changes Techno Blast to an Electric-type move when held by Genesect.

name: Silk Scarf
effect: Increases the power of Normal-type moves.

name: Silver Powder
effect: Increases the power of Bug-type moves.

name: Sky Plate
effect: Increases power of Flying-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Flying.

name: Smoke Ball
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It enables the holder to flee from any wild Pokémon without fail.

name: Smooth Rock
effect: A Pokémon held item that extends the duration of the move Sandstorm used by the holder.

name: Snowball
effect: Raises Attack if hit by an Ice-type move.

name: Soft Sand
effect: Increases the power of Ground-type moves.

name: Soothe Bell
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a bell with a comforting chime that calms the holder and makes it friendly.

name: Soul Dew
effect: Increases the power of Psychic- and Dragon-type moves when held by Latios or Latias. Increases Sp.Atk/Sp.Def prior to Gen 7.

name: Spell Tag
effect: Increases the power of Ghost-type moves.

name: Splash Plate
effect: Increases power of Water-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Water.

name: Spooky Plate
effect: Increases power of Ghost-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Ghost.

name: Steel Memory
effect: Changes Silvally and its move Multi-Attack to Steel type.

name: Sticky Barb
effect: A held item that damages the holder on every turn. It may latch on to foes and allies that touch the holder.

name: Stone Plate
effect: Increases power of Rock-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Rock.

name: Terrain Extender
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the duration of the terrain caused by the holder's move or Ability.

name: Thick Club
effect: Increases Attack when held by Cubone or Marowak.

name: Throat Spray
effect: Raises Sp. Atk when a sound-based move is used.

name: Toxic Orb
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is a bizarre orb that badly poisons the holder in battle.

name: Toxic Plate
effect: Increases power of Poison-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Poison.

name: Twisted Spoon
effect: Increases the power of Psychic-type moves.

name: Utility Umbrella
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This sturdy umbrella protects the holder from the effects of weather.

name: Water Memory
effect: Changes Silvally and its move Multi-Attack to Water type.

name: Wave Incense
effect: Increases the power of Water-type moves. Breeding Mantine produces Mantyke when held.

name: Weakness Policy
effect: Sharply raises Attack and Special Attack if hit by a super-effective move.

name: Wide Lens
effect: Increases the accuracy of moves.

name: Wise Glasses
effect: Increases the power of Special-category moves.

name: Yellow Nectar
effect: A flower nectar obtained at Melemele Meadow. It changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

name: Zap Plate
effect: Increases power of Electric-type moves. Changes Arceus' type to Electric.

name: Zoom Lens
effect: Raises a move's accuracy if the holder moves after its target.

name: Water Gem
effect: Increases the power of a Water-type move only once.

name: White Herb
effect: An item to be held by a POKéMON. It restores any lowered stat in battle. It can be used only once.

name: Steel Gem
effect: Increases the power of a Steel-type move only once.

name: Rock Gem
effect: Increases the power of a Rock-type move only once.

name: Psychic Seed
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Def on Psychic Terrain. It can only be used once.

name: Psychic Gem
effect: Increases the power of a Psychic-type move only once.

name: Poison Gem
effect: Increases the power of a Poison-type move only once.

name: Normal Gem
effect: Increases the power of a Normal-type move only once.

name: Misty Seed
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Def on Misty Terrain. It can only be used once.

name: Mental Herb
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It snaps the holder out of infatuation. It can be used only once.

name: Ice Gem
effect: Increases the power of an Ice-type move only once.

name: Ground Gem
effect: Increases the power of a Ground-type move only once.

name: Grassy Seed
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Defense on Grassy Terrain. It can only be used once.

name: Grass Gem
effect: Increases the power of a Grass-type move only once.

name: Ghost Gem
effect: Increases the power of a Ghost-type move only once.

name: Flying Gem
effect: Increases the power of a Flying-type move only once.

name: Fire Gem
effect: Increases the power of a Fire-type move only once.

name: Fighting Gem
effect: Increases the power of a Fighting-type move only once.

name: Electric Seed
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Defense on Electric Terrain. It can only be used once.

name: Electric Gem
effect: Increases the power of an Electric-type move only once.

name: Dragon Gem
effect: Increases the power of a Dragon-type move only once.

name: Dark Gem
effect: Increases the power of a Dark-type move only once.

name: Bug Gem
effect: Increases the power of a Bug-type move only once.

name: Adrenaline Orb
effect: Using it makes wild Pokémon more likely to call for help. If held by a Pokémon, it boosts Speed when intimidated. It can be used only once.

name: Sweet Apple
effect: Evolves Applin into Appletun.

name: Tart Apple
effect: Evolves Applin into Flapple.

name: Star Sweet
effect: Evolves Milcery into Star Flavor Alcremie.

name: Ribbon Sweet
effect: Evolves Milcery into Ribbon Flavor Alcremie.

name: Love Sweet
effect: Evolves Milcery into Heart Flavor Alcremie.

name: Flower Sweet
effect: Evolves Milcery into Flower Flavor Alcremie.

name: Berry Sweet
effect: Evolves Milcery into Blueberry Flavor Alcremie.

name: Clover Sweet
effect: Evolves Milcery into Clover Flavor Alcremie.

name: Chipped Pot
effect: Evolves Sinistea into Polteageist.

name: Cracked Pot
effect: Evolves Sinistea into Polteageist.

name: Everstone
effect: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The Pokémon holding this peculiar stone is prevented from evolving.

name: Adamant Orb
effect: Increases the power of Dragon- and Steel-type moves when held by Dialga.

name: Amulet Coin
effect: Doubles prize money if held.

name: Luck Incense
effect: Doubles prize money if held. Breeding Chansey or Blissey produces Happiny when held.

name: Elevator Key
effect: A card key that activates the elevator in Lysandre Labs. It is emblazoned with Team Flare's logo.

name: Strawberry Sweet
effect: Evolves Milcery into Strawberry Flavor Alcremie.

name: Metal Powder
effect: Increases Defense when held by Ditto.

name: Leek
effect: Increases critical-hit ratio when held by Farfetch'd.

name: Aloraichium Z
effect: Allows Alolan Raichu to upgrade Thunderbolt to a Z-Move, Stoked Sparksurfer.

name: Buginium Z
effect: Allows the use of Savage Spin-Out, the Bug type Z-Move.

name: Darkinium Z
effect: Allows the use of Black Hole Eclipse, the Dark type Z-Move.

name: Decidium Z
effect: Allows Decidueye to upgrade Spirit Shackle to a Z-Move, Sinister Arrow Raid.

name: Eevium Z
effect: Allows Eevee to upgrade Last Resort to a Z-Move, Extreme Evoboost.

name: Electrium Z
effect: Allows the use of Gigavolt Havoc, the Electric type Z-Move.

name: Fairium Z
effect: Allows the use of Twinkle Tackle, the Fairy type Z-Move.

name: Fightinium Z
effect: Allows the use of All-Out Pummeling, the Fighting type Z-Move.

name: Firium Z
effect: Allows the use of Inferno Overdrive, the Fire type Z-Move.

name: Flyinium Z
effect: Allows the use of Supersonic Skystrike, the Flying type Z-Move.

name: Ghostium Z
effect: Allows the use of Never-Ending Nightmare, the Ghost type Z-Move.

name: Grassium Z
effect: Allows the use of Bloom Doom, the Grass type Z-Move.

name: Groundium Z
effect: Allows the use of Tectonic Rage, the Ground type Z-Move.

name: Icium Z
effect: Allows the use of Subzero Slammer, the Ice type Z-Move.

name: Incinium Z
effect: Allows Incineroar to upgrade Darkest Lariat to a Z-Move, Malicious Moonsault.

name: Kommonium Z
effect: Allows Kommo-o to upgrade Clanging Scales to a Z-Move, Clangorous Soulblaze.

name: Lunalium Z
effect: Allows Lunala to upgrade Moongeist Beam to a Z-Move, Menacing Moonraze Maelstrom.

name: Lycanium Z
effect: Allows Lycanroc to upgrade Stone Edge to a Z-Move, Splintered Stormshards.

name: Marshadium Z
effect: Allows Marshadow to upgrade Spectral Thief to a Z-Move, Soul-Stealing 7-Star Strike.

name: Mewnium Z
effect: Allows Mew to upgrade Psychic to a Z-Move, Genesis Supernova.

name: Mimikium Z
effect: Allows Mimikyu to upgrade Play Rough to a Z-Move, Let's Snuggle Forever.

name: Normalium Z
effect: Allows the use of Breakneck Blitz, the Normal type Z-Move.

name: Pikanium Z
effect: Allows Pikachu to upgrade Volt Tackle to a Z-Move, Catastropika.

name: Pikashunium Z
effect: Allows Pikachu in a cap to upgrade Thunderbolt to a Z-Move, 10,000,000 Volt Thunderbolt.

name: Poisonium Z
effect: Allows the use of Acid Downpour, the Poison type Z-Move.

name: Primarium Z
effect: Allows Primarina to upgrade Sparkling Aria to a Z-Move, Oceanic Operetta.

name: Psychium Z
effect: Allows the use of Shattered Psyche, the Psychic type Z-Move.

name: Rockium Z
effect: Allows the use of Continental Crush, the Rock type Z-Move.

name: Snorlium Z
effect: Allows Snorlax to upgrade Giga Impact to a Z-Move, Pulverizing Pancake.

name: Solganium Z
effect: Allows Solgaleo to upgrade Sunsteel Strike to a Z-Move, Searing Sunraze Smash.

name: Steelium Z
effect: Allows the use of Corkscrew Crash, the Steel type Z-Move.

name: Tapunium Z
effect: Allows the Tapus to upgrade Nature's Madness to a Z-Move, Guardian of Alola.

name: Ultranecrozium Z
effect: Allows Ultra Necrozma to upgrade Photon Geyser to a Z-Move, Light That Burns the Sky.

name: Waterium Z
effect: Allows the use of Hydro Vortex, the Water type Z-Move.
